item.description:
Every 4th Friday evening at the Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center at 950 Massachusetts Avenue, between Central and Harvard Squares, Cambridge, is the dharmachat, or meditation plus dharma talk.

7:00 p.m.  Meditation
( Sitting and Breathing , led by a Buddhist nun or by a leader in training) 
7:25 p.m. Dharma Talk and Discussion (scheduled to finish around 9:00 pm)
(At no cost, tea, health-supporting sweet beverages, and non-dairy vegetarian snacks are provided)

Program organized by Ven. Miao Wei and Marjorie Jacobs (BU psychotherapist and leader in training).
They will provide open dialogue around Buddhist-consistent
(a) perspectives affirming the importance of cultivating and
(b) insights relating to issues in modern living.

Take the T to Central Square, http://www.mbta.com
Walk in TOWARDS Harvard Square until you see 950 Mass Ave on the left (south) side of the street.

Please invite your friends and family.  If you have any questions, please call the GBBCC.

Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center - Omitofo for the event at GBBCC
950 Massachusetts Avenue (#1 bus, between Red Line stops at Central Square and Harvard Square)
Cambridge, MA
617-547-6670

http://www.GBBC.net. - IF you speak and read Mandarin - Chinese language site has a security warning, but it's SAFE

http://pluralism.org - HDS Pluralism Project Profile-Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center (GBBCC) - includes history and statistics

We look forward to seeing you there! We'll be there from 7:00pm to 8:30pm
item.how_to_find_us: Ask anyone at GBBCC who seems to be 'in the know'
item.why: Buddhist-Interested persons should learn about Buddhism; free tea and non-dairy vegetarian snacks are provided without cost to meditators who stay for the dharmachat - where we share our ideas with each other amidst the leaders' mentorship.
